de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.algo.suffixtrees.naive
Class SuffixTreeNode

java.lang.Object
  de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.algo.suffixtrees.naive.SuffixTreeNode

public class SuffixTreeNode
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a node in a suffix tree. Contains a collection of nodes, the immediate children of this node and thus forms a recursive data structure.

Author:
Fabian Steeg

Constructor Detail

SuffixTreeNode

public SuffixTreeNode(SuffixTreeNode parent,
                      java.lang.String incomingLabel,
                      int depth,
                      int label,
                      int id)
Constructor for a node with a parent, that is, for any node except the root node.

Parameters:
parent - The parent node of this node.
incomingLabel - The label for the incoming edge of this node.
depth - The node depth to be assigned to this node.
label - The label for this node (Nodes are currently labeled with leaf numbers).

SuffixTreeNode

public SuffixTreeNode()
Empty constructor, for the root node.

Method Detail

addSuffix

public void addSuffix(java.util.List<java.lang.String> suffix,
                      int pathIndex)
Parameters:
suffix - The suffix to insert into the suffix tree, will be inserted behind the maximum prefix of the suffix found in the tree.
pathIndex - The path index for labeling the leaf at the end of the path of the suffix added.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
Return s string representation of this node and all the children, that is the subtree starting inthis node.
See Also:
Object.toString()

toDotString

public java.lang.String toDotString()
Recursively exports the node and all children as dot

Returns:
Returns the tree as a dot string (www.graphviz.org)

isRoot

Returns:
Returns true if this node is the root node.

Returns true if this node is a leaf.

getNodeDepth

public int getNodeDepth()
Returns:
Returns the node depth of this node, that is, how many edges are on a path from the root node to this node.
